1â†’/**
     2â†’ * @file ManagerApp.tsx
     3â†’ * @description Main application component that manages routing, setup workflow, and dashboard navigation.
     4â†’ * This is the root component of the Claude Agent Manager UI, handling the complete application lifecycle
     5â†’ * from initial setup through project validation to the main dashboard interface.
     6â†’ *
     7â†’ * ## Features
     8â†’ * - **Two-Phase Workflow**: Setup phase for project initialization, dashboard phase for management
     9â†’ * - **Multi-Step Setup**: Home â†’ Landing (directory selection) â†’ Validation â†’ Dashboard
    10â†’ * - **Routing Configuration**: Client-side routing between 8 different dashboard views
    11â†’ * - **Directory Management**: Persistent directory selection via localStorage with change capability
    12â†’ * - **Project Validation**: Automated validation of Claude Code CLI, SDK, and project structure
    13â†’ * - **Resource Discovery**: Automatic parsing and loading of agents, commands, and skills
    14â†’ * - **State Management**: Centralized state for view navigation, directory, and discovered resources
    15â†’ * - **Error Handling**: Comprehensive error handling with retry capability for validation failures
    16â†’ *
    17â†’ * ## Application Lifecycle
    18â†’ * The app follows a sequential lifecycle from initialization through to active management:
    19â†’ *
    20â†’ * ### 1. Initialization (Mount)
    21â†’ * - **Load Saved Directory**: Check localStorage for 'claude-agent-manager-dir' key
    22â†’ * - **Restore State**: If directory found, populate directoryName state
    23â†’ * - **Default View**: Start in 'setup' view with 'home' step
    24â†’ * - **No Auto-Navigation**: User must explicitly start the workflow
    25â†’ *
    26â†’ * ### 2. Setup Phase (view='setup')
    27â†’ * The setup phase consists of three steps:
    28â†’ *
    29â†’ * #### Step 1: Home (setupStep='home')
    30â†’ * - **Display**: HomePage component with welcome message and "Get Started" button
    31â†’ * - **User Action**: Click "Get Started" to proceed
    32â†’ * - **Transition**: `handleGetStarted()` â†’ setupStep='landing'
    33â†’ *
    34â†’ * #### Step 2: Landing (setupStep='landing')
    35â†’ * - **Display**: LandingPage component with directory selection interface
    36â†’ * - **Directory Selection**: User enters directory path (text input)
    37â†’ * - **State Updates**: `handleDirectoryChange(path)` saves to state and localStorage
    38â†’ * - **Validation**: Next button enabled only when directoryHandle is set
    39â†’ * - **User Actions**:
    40â†’ *   - Back button â†’ return to home step, clear directory
    41â†’ *   - Next button â†’ proceed to validation step
    42â†’ * - **Transition**: `handleNextFromLanding()` â†’ setupStep='validating'
    43â†’ *
    44â†’ * #### Step 3: Validating (setupStep='validating')
    45â†’ * - **Display**: ValidationPage component showing 6 validation steps with status
    46â†’ * - **Automatic Execution**: `startValidation()` called automatically on mount
    47â†’ * - **Validation Steps**:
    48â†’ *   1. CLI check: Verify Claude Code CLI exists
    49â†’ *   2. SDK check: Verify Claude SDK installation
    50â†’ *   3. Folder check: Look for .claude folder in directory
    51â†’ *   4. Agents parsing: Parse and validate agent configurations
    52â†’ *   5. Commands parsing: Parse slash commands
    53â†’ *   6. Skills parsing: Parse skill definitions
    54â†’ * - **API Calls**:
    55â†’ *   - `api.validateProject(directory)` â†’ validation results
    56â†’ *   - `api.analyzeProject(directory)` â†’ discovered resources (if all validation passes)
    57â†’ * - **Success Path**: All steps pass â†’ load resources â†’ transition to dashboard
    58â†’ * - **Failure Path**: Any step fails â†’ show error message with retry button
    59â†’ * - **Transition**: All success â†’ view='dashboard', managerView=Dashboard
    60â†’ *
    61â†’ * ### 3. Dashboard Phase (view='dashboard')
    62â†’ * Once validation succeeds, the app enters the main dashboard interface:
    63â†’ *
    64â†’ * - **Layout**: Full Layout component with Sidebar navigation
    65â†’ * - **Active View**: Controlled by managerView state (ManagerView enum)
    66â†’ * - **Navigation**: Sidebar onNavigate callback updates managerView
    67â†’ * - **Page Rendering**: `renderDashboardContent()` renders page based on managerView
    68â†’ * - **Directory Display**: Sidebar shows selected directory with "Change Directory" button
    69â†’ * - **Change Directory**: Returns to setup phase (landing step) with directory preserved
    70â†’ *
    71â†’ * ## Routing Configuration
    72â†’ * Client-side routing is managed through the ManagerView enum and state-based rendering:
    73â†’ *
    74â†’ * ### View Routes (ManagerView enum)
    75â†’ * 1. **Dashboard** (ManagerView.Dashboard)
    76â†’ *    - Component: DashboardPage
    77â†’ *    - Purpose: Overview metrics and quick actions
    78â†’ *    - Container: Full layout with container
    79â†’ *
    80â†’ * 2. **Chat** (ManagerView.Chat)
    81â†’ *    - Component: ChatPage
    82â†’ *    - Purpose: Interactive chat sessions with agents and skills
    83â†’ *    - Container: Full layout WITHOUT container (noContainer=true for full-width)
    84â†’ *
    85â†’ * 3. **Agents** (ManagerView.Agents)
    86â†’ *    - Component: AgentsPage
    87â†’ *    - Purpose: Agent listing, creation, editing, execution
    88â†’ *    - Props: agents array, directory, onAgentCreated callback
    89â†’ *    - Container: Full layout with container
    90â†’ *
    91â†’ * 4. **Commands** (ManagerView.Commands)
    92â†’ *    - Component: CommandsPage
    93â†’ *    - Purpose: Slash command listing and execution
    94â†’ *    - Props: commands array
    95â†’ *    - Container: Full layout with container
    96â†’ *
    97â†’ * 5. **Skills** (ManagerView.Skills)
    98â†’ *    - Component: SkillsPage
    99â†’ *    - Purpose: Skill management, creation, training
   100â†’ *    - Props: skills array, onRefresh callback
   101â†’ *    - Container: Full layout with container
   102â†’ *
   103â†’ * 6. **MCPServers** (ManagerView.MCPServers)
   104â†’ *    - Component: MCPServersPage
   105â†’ *    - Purpose: MCP server configuration and tool management
   106â†’ *    - Props: directory
   107â†’ *    - Container: Full layout with container
   108â†’ *
   109â†’ * 7. **Tasks** (ManagerView.Tasks)
   110â†’ *    - Component: TasksPage
   111â†’ *    - Purpose: Task execution history and status
   112â†’ *    - Container: Full layout with container
   113â†’ *
   114â†’ * 8. **Flows** (ManagerView.Flows)
   115â†’ *    - Component: FlowsPage, FlowEditorPage, FlowDetailPage
   116â†’ *    - Purpose: Flow creation, editing, and viewing
   117â†’ *    - Container: Full layout with container
   118â†’ *
   119â†’ * 9. **Settings** (ManagerView.Settings)
   120â†’ *    - Component: SettingsPage
   121â†’ *    - Purpose: Application settings and preferences
   122â†’ *    - Props: directoryName, onDirectoryChange callback
   123â†’ *    - Container: Full layout with container
   124â†’ *
   125â†’ * ### Route Switching
   126â†’ * - **Trigger**: Sidebar navigation item click
   127â†’ * - **Handler**: `setManagerView(newView)` called by sidebar onNavigate
   128â†’ * - **Re-Render**: App re-renders, renderDashboardContent() returns new page component
   129â†’ * - **Layout Persistence**: Layout and Sidebar remain mounted, only main content changes
   130â†’ * - **No Page Reload**: Pure client-side routing with React state
   131â†’ *
   132â†’ * ## Directory Management
   133â†’ * Directory selection is central to the app, enabling project-specific resource management:
   134â†’ *
   135â†’ * ### Directory Selection Flow
   136â†’ * 1. **User Input**: Enter path in LandingPage text input
   137â†’ * 2. **Handle Change**: `handleDirectoryChange(path)` invoked
   138â†’ * 3. **State Updates**:
   139â†’ *    - `setDirectoryName(path)` â†’ updates UI with selected path
   140â†’ *    - `setDirectoryHandle({})` â†’ marks directory as selected (enables Next button)
   141â†’ *    - `localStorage.setItem('claude-agent-manager-dir', path)` â†’ persists selection
   142â†’ * 4. **Propagation**: Directory passed as prop to all resource-dependent components
   143â†’ *
   144â†’ * ### Directory Persistence
   145â†’ * - **Storage Key**: 'claude-agent-manager-dir'
   146â†’ * - **Storage Type**: localStorage (persists across sessions)
   147â†’ * - **Load Timing**: useEffect on mount (runs once)
   148â†’ * - **Restoration**: If found, populates directoryName state
   149â†’ * - **Clear Trigger**: "Back to Home" button in LandingPage
   150â†’ *
   151â†’ * ### Directory Usage
   152â†’ * Directory is passed to components that need project context:
   153â†’ * - **API Calls**: validateProject(directory), analyzeProject(directory), getAgents(directory), getSkills(directory)
   154â†’ * - **Component Props**: AgentsPage, MCPServersPage, SettingsPage, AgentCreatorChatPanel, SkillCreatorChatPanel
   155â†’ * - **Sidebar Display**: Shows current directory name with truncation
   156â†’ *
   157â†’ * ### Change Directory Flow
   158â†’ * 1. **Trigger**: Click "Change Directory" button in Sidebar
   159â†’ * 2. **Handler**: `handleChangeDirectory()` called
   160â†’ * 3. **State Changes**:
   161â†’ *    - `setView('setup')` â†’ return to setup phase
   162â†’ *    - `setSetupStep('landing')` â†’ go directly to directory selection
   163â†’ *    - `setDirectoryHandle(null)` â†’ clear selection flag
   164â†’ *    - Keep directoryName â†’ user sees last selection in input
   165â†’ * 4. **User Flow**: User can enter new path â†’ re-validate â†’ return to dashboard
   166â†’ *
   167â†’ * ## State Management
   168â†’ * The app manages multiple categories of state for coordinating the complex workflow:
   169â†’ *
   170â†’ * ### View Navigation State
   171â†’ * - **view**: 'setup' | 'dashboard' - Top-level phase toggle
   172â†’ * - **setupStep**: 'home' | 'landing' | 'validating' - Setup sub-steps
   173â†’ * - **managerView**: ManagerView enum - Dashboard page routing
   174â†’ *
   175â†’ * ### Directory State
   176â†’ * - **directoryHandle**: object | null - Selection flag for enabling Next button
   177â†’ * - **directoryName**: string | undefined - Selected directory path for display and API calls
   178â†’ *
   179â†’ * ### Validation State
   180â†’ * - **validationSteps**: ValidationStep[] - Array of 6 validation steps with status/error
   181â†’ * - Each step: `{ id, label, status: 'pending'|'l

... [truncated - full output was 30012 chars]

Could not parse command for security validation: cat > ./.auto-claude/specs/010-flows-sayfas-n-n-react-flow-ile-s-r-kle-b-rak-ve-a/build-progress.txt << 'EOF'
# React Flow Integration - Build Progress

## Status: Planning Complete

## Last Updated: 2026-01-02

---

## Summary
Transform the Flows page into a visual drag-and-drop workflow builder similar to n8n and Langchain, using React Flow for intuitive node-based workflow design.

## Implementation Plan Overview

### Phase 1: Setup & Infrastructure (3 subtasks)
- [ ] 1.1 Install React Flow Dependencies (@xyflow/react)
- [ ] 1.2 Create React Flow Types
- [ ] 1.3 Create Flow Canvas Context

### Phase 2: Custom Node Components (5 subtasks)
- [ ] 2.1 Create Base Node Component
- [ ] 2.2 Create Input Node Component
- [ ] 2.3 Create Agent Node Component
- [ ] 2.4 Create Output Node Component
- [ ] 2.5 Create Node Registry and Factory

### Phase 3: Flow Canvas Component (5 subtasks)
- [ ] 3.1 Create Node Palette Component
- [ ] 3.2 Create Flow Canvas Component
- [ ] 3.3 Create Custom Edge Component
- [ ] 3.4 Create Canvas Toolbar Component
- [ ] 3.5 Create Node Configuration Panel

### Phase 4: Flow Editor Integration (4 subtasks)
- [ ] 4.1 Create Flow Data Converter
- [ ] 4.2 Create Visual Flow Editor Page
- [ ] 4.3 Update Flow Editor Routing
- [ ] 4.4 Add Flow Validation

### Phase 5: Polish & Enhancements (5 subtasks)
- [ ] 5.1 Add Keyboard Shortcuts
- [ ] 5.2 Add Auto-Layout Algorithm
- [ ] 5.3 Add Connection Validation
- [ ] 5.4 Add Flow Preview Mode
- [ ] 5.5 Add CSS Styling and Theming

---

## Key Technical Decisions

### Library Choice: React Flow (@xyflow/react v12)
React Flow was selected as the primary library for the following reasons:
- Mature and well-documented
- Purpose-built for node-based editors
- Excellent TypeScript support
- Built-in features: drag-drop, zooming, panning, mini-map
- Large community and active maintenance
- Used by similar tools (n8n uses a custom implementation but React Flow is the standard)

### Alternative Libraries Considered
- **react-diagrams**: More complex, steeper learning curve
- **beautiful-dnd**: Not designed for graph editing
- **rete.js**: Steeper learning curve, more opinionated

### Architecture Decisions
1. **Custom Node Components**: Extend React Flow's base Node with custom styling
2. **Reuse Existing Components**: Node configuration panels will reuse InputNodeConfig, AgentNodeConfig, OutputNodeConfig
3. **Backward Compatibility**: Existing Flow data structure will be preserved through conversion utilities
4. **No Backend Changes**: The existing backend API already supports the required node structure

---

## Estimated Timeline
- Total Estimated Hours: 38
- Target Completion: 2026-01-15
- Priority: High

---

## Dependencies
- @xyflow/react (React Flow v12) - Primary
- dagre (optional) - For auto-layout algorithm

---

## Progress Log

### 2026-01-02
- Created comprehensive implementation plan with 22 subtasks across 5 phases
- Analyzed existing codebase structure (FlowsPage, FlowEditorPage, FlowDetailPage)
- Identified reusable components (node config components)
- Selected React Flow as the primary library
- No implementation started yet - planning phase complete
EOF

I've read the spec and created a comprehensive implementation plan. Here's a summary:

## Implementation Plan Created âœ…

**Feature:** React Flow Integration - Visual Flow Builder

Transform the Flows page into a visual drag-and-drop workflow builder similar to **n8n** and **Langchain**.

### 5 Phases with 22 Subtasks

| Phase | Name | Subtasks | Est. Hours |
|-------|------|----------|------------|
| 1 | Setup & Infrastructure | 3 | 3 hrs |
| 2 | Custom Node Components | 5 | 9 hrs |
| 3 | Flow Canvas Component | 5 | 10 hrs |
| 4 | Flow Editor Integration | 4 | 7.5 hrs |
| 5 | Polish & Enhancements | 5 | 8 hrs |
| **Total** | | **22** | **~38 hrs** |

### Key Technical Decision: **React Flow (@xyflow/react v12)**

Selected because:
- Purpose-built for node-based editors
- Excellent TypeScript support  
- Built-in drag-drop, zooming, panning, mini-map
- Well-documented with active community

### Architecture Highlights

1. **Reuse existing components** - InputNodeConfig, AgentNodeConfig, OutputNodeConfig will be used in the side panel
2. **Backward compatible** - Existing Flow data structure preserved via conversion utilities
3. **No backend changes needed** - Current API already supports required node structure
4. **Custom node types** - Input (blue), Agent (purple), Output (green) with distinct styling

### Files Created
- `.auto-claude/specs/.../implementation_plan.json` - Detailed subtask plan
- `.auto-claude/specs/.../build-progress.txt` - Progress tracking

Ready to begin implementation with Phase 1, Subtask 1.1 (Install React Flow Dependencies) when you're ready!
I'll implement subtask 1.1 by installing React Flow v12 and required dependencies. Let me start by understanding the current state of the project.

     9â†’## Summary
    10â†’Transform the Flows page into a visual drag-and-drop workflow builder similar to n8n and Langchain, using React Flow for intuitive node-based workflow design.
    11â†’
    12â†’## Implementation Plan Overview
    13â†’
    14â†’### Phase 1: Setup & Infrastructure (3 subtasks)
    15â†’- [ ] 1.1 Install React Flow Dependencies (@xyflow/react)
    16â†’- [ ] 1.2 Create React Flow Types

    18â†’

    20â†’- [ ] 2.1 Create Base Node Component
    21â†’- [ ] 2.2 Create Input Node Component
    22â†’- [ ] 2.3 Create Agent Node Component
    23â†’- [ ] 2.4 Create Output Node Component

    25â†’
    26â†’### Phase 3: Flow Canvas Component (5 subtasks)
    27â†’- [ ] 3.1 Create Node Palette Component
    28â†’- [ ] 3.2 Create Flow Canvas Component
    29â†’- [ ] 3.3 Create Custom Edge Component
    30â†’- [ ] 3.4 Create Canvas Toolbar Component
    31â†’- [ ] 3.5 Create Node Configuration Panel
    32â†’
    33â†’### Phase 4: Flow Editor Integration (4 subtasks)
    34â†’- [ ] 4.1 Create Flow Data Converter
    35â†’- [ ] 4.2 Create Visual Flow Editor Page
    36â†’- [ ] 4.3 Update Flow Editor Routing
    37â†’- [ ] 4.4 Add Flow Validation
    38â†’
    39â†’### Phase 5: Polish & Enhancements (5 subtasks)
    40â†’- [ ] 5.1 Add Keyboard Shortcuts
    41â†’- [ ] 5.2 Add Auto-Layout Algorithm
    42â†’- [ ] 5.3 Add Connection Validation
    43â†’- [ ] 5.4 Add Flow Preview Mode
    44â†’- [ ] 5.5 Add CSS Styling and Theming
    45â†’
    46â†’---
    47â†’
    48â†’## Key Technical Decisions
    49â†’
    50â†’### Library Choice: React Flow (@xyflow/react v12)
    51â†’React Flow was selected as the primary library for the following reasons:
    52â†’- Mature and well-documented
    53â†’- Purpose-built for node-based editors
    54â†’- Excellent TypeScript support
    55â†’- Built-in features: drag-drop, zooming, panning, mini-map
    56â†’- Large community and active maintenance
    57â†’- Used by similar tools (n8n uses a custom implementation but React Flow is the standard)
    58â†’
    59â†’### Alternative Libraries Considered
    60â†’- **react-diagrams**: More complex, steeper learning curve
    61â†’- **beautiful-dnd**: Not designed for graph editing
    62â†’- **rete.js**: Steeper learning curve, more opinionated
    63â†’
    64â†’### Architecture Decisions
    65â†’1. **Custom Node Components**: Extend React Flow's base Node with custom styling
    66â†’2. **Reuse Existing Components**: Node configuration panels will reuse InputNodeConfig, AgentNodeConfig, OutputNodeConfig
    67â†’3. **Backward Compatibility**: Existing Flow data structure will be preserved through conversion utilities
    68â†’4. **No Backend Changes**: The existing backend API already supports the required node structure
    69â†’
    70â†’---
    71â†’
    72â†’## Estimated Timeline
    73â†’- Total Estimated Hours: 38
    74â†’- Target Completion: 2026-01-15
    75â†’- Priority: High
    76â†’
    77â†’---
    78â†’
    79â†’## Dependencies
    80â†’- @xyflow/react (React Flow v12) - Primary
    81â†’- dagre (optional) - For auto-layout algorithm
